title: Prime spectrum of a number field
author: HÃ¥vard Damm-Johnsen
notes: The prime spectrum of the number field $x^7 + 41$. For more details, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spectrum_of_a_ring. The code is available at: https://github.com/havarddj/drawspec
code:
# Requires SageMath and PyTikz 
K.<a> = NumberField(x^7 + 41) # class number is 7
specK = NumberFieldSpec(K, nprimes=20)
specK.color_classes(True)
specK.curve(True)
specK.pic()

title: Mobius Transformation of Circles
author: Jiri Minarcik
code:
Center r


Circle c1, c2, c3


Shape ic1 := Inversion(c1, r)
Shape ic2 := Inversion(c2, r)
Shape ic3 := Inversion(c3, r)


Label r $S^1$


Label c1 $c_1$
Label c2 $c_2$
Label c3 $c_3$


Label ic1 $c'_1$
Label ic2 $c'_2$
Label ic3 $c'_3$

title: Rhumb Line on Sphere
author: Tom Edgar
notes:
TikZ in LaTeX
This shows a rhumb line on a sphere.
code:
\documentclass[tikz, border=.2in]{standalone}
\usepackage{pgfplots}
\pgfplotsset{compat=1.8}
\usepgfplotslibrary{colormaps}


\begin{document}
\begin{tikzpicture}[scale=2]
  \begin{axis}[
      axis equal,
    width=10cm,
    height=10cm,
    axis lines = none,
    ticks=none,
    enlargelimits=0.3,
    view={75}{12},
    scale uniformly strategy=units only,colormap/viridis]


	\addplot3[variable=t, red, dashed, thick, samples=100,domain=80:240,samples y=0]  ({cos(t)/cosh(t/tan(89.83))}, {sin(t))/cosh(t/tan(89.83))}, {tanh(t/tan(89.83)}); %draws a back dashed line
	\addplot3[variable=t, red, dashed, thick, samples=100,domain=440:600,samples y=0]  ({cos(t)/cosh(t/tan(89.83))}, {sin(t))/cosh(t/tan(89.83))}, {tanh(t/tan(89.83)}); %draws a back dashed line
	
	\addplot3[%
    opacity = 0.2,
    surf,
    samples = 50,
    z buffer = sort,
    shader=faceted interp,
    variable = \u,
    variable y = \v,
    domain = 0:180,
    y domain = 0:360,
  ]
  ({cos(u)*sin(v)}, {sin(u)*sin(v)}, {cos(v)}); %draws the sphere


	\addplot3[variable=t,red, samples=100,domain=600:4*360,samples y=0]  ({cos(t)/cosh(t/tan(89.83))}, {sin(t))/cosh(t/tan(89.83))}, {tanh(t/tan(89.83)}); %draws a front solid line


	\addplot3[variable=t, red, thick, samples=100,domain=0:80,samples y=0]  ({cos(t)/cosh(t/tan(89.83))}, {sin(t))/cosh(t/tan(89.83))}, {tanh(t/tan(89.83)}); %draws a front solid line
	
	\addplot3[variable=t, red, thick, samples=100,domain=240:440,samples y=0]  ({cos(t)/cosh(t/tan(89.83))}, {sin(t))/cosh(t/tan(89.83))}, {tanh(t/tan(89.83)}); %draws a front solid line
\end{axis}
\end{tikzpicture}
\end{document}

title: Chaos Game: Sierpinski Triangle
author: Jiri Minarcik
code:
Seed p_0
Point p_i := NextPoint(p_j) for i in [1, 500], j in [0, 500] where i == j + 1


Corner c_i for i in [1, 3]

title: The 2-adic upper half-plane
author: HÃ¥vard Damm-Johnsen
notes:
The $2$-adic upper half plane, visualised as a tubular neighbourhood of the Bruhat-Tits tree for $\operatorname{GL}_2$. 
For more details, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drinfeld_upper_half_plane.
